titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Office of the Vice President, Office Files of David Bell
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Office of the Vice President, Office Files of David Bell FA624
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Claire McCurdy, Ford Foundation Archives, July 1984

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-01 01:40:43 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Office of the Vice President, Office Files of David Bell
did.abstract:
The papers of David Bell, Vice President of the Ford Foundation's International Division from 1966 to 1981, document his activities at the Ford Foundation and those of the International Division during this period. They were sent to the Foundation's Archives in July 1981 by Alice Maloney, who served as Secretary and Executive Assistant to Mr. Bell for the duration of his tenure.
The papers consist primarily of correspondence, memoranda, and Bell's rough notes summarizing meetings and conferences attended. They are divided into six series. The series' order is based on substance and size. Arrangement of files within a series corresponds closely to the original order established by Ms. Maloney.
The papers are particularly rich in the following areas:
- the activities of the International Division: the Office of the Vice President and the overseas field offices (Series I)
- the annual meetings of the Board of Trustees and its subcommittees (Series II)
- the activities of the international agricultural center system, including the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (Series IV)
- the Foundation's Population Program (Series V)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David E. Bell, Executive Vice President of the Ford Foundation's International Division, was a member of the Foundation staff from June 1966 until his retirement in August 1981. During this period, he held the following positions:
- March 1969, Executive Vice President, International Division

David Bell was born on January 20, 1919. He received his B.A. degree with highest honors from Pomona College of Claremont, California, in 1939, and was elected Phi Beta Kappa. In 1941, he earned an M.A. in Economics from Harvard University.
Prior to Bell's career with the Ford Foundation, he held the following positions:
- 1942, Budget Examiner, U.S. Bureau of the Budget
- 1945-51, Assistant to the Chief, Fiscal Division, The White House
- 1951-53, Administrative Assistant to the President, The White House
- 1954-57, Field Supervi sor, Pakistan Planning Board Project, IIE - Harvard University, Pakistan
- 1957-60, Lecturer, Economics; Secretary, Graduate School of Public Administration, Harvard University
- 1961-62, Director, U.S. Bureau of the Budget
After his retirement from the Foundation, Mr. Bell joined the Faculty of the Harvard University School of Public Health.
Mr. Bell's personal papers have been donated to the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library. Other papers are at the Harry Truman Presidential Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: David Bell's papers document his Foundation activities from 1966 to 1981, particularly in the following areas:
- the International Division: the Office of the Vice President and the overseas field offices;
- the Board of Trustees and its subcommittees;
- the International Agricultural Center system, including the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research and the International Food Policy Research Institute;
- the Foundation's Population Program.

They reflect Bell's involvement with policy development and implementation, program and budget planning and administration, administrative procedures, and meetings and conferences for the following programs in the International Division: Office of the Vice President (OVP), Asia and the Pacific (AP), Europe and International Affairs (EIA), Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC), and Middle East and Africa (MEA).

The papers contain materials on a review (the Overseas Development Self-Study, or "0peration Janus", initiated by F. Champion Ward) and reorganization of the Foundation's international activities into programs based upon geographical areas. There is also material on the planning and implementation of the 1979-1980 Program Reviews in preparation for the second Foundation-wide program reorganization.

For Ford Foundation International Division meetings and conferences from 1966 to 1979, the papers contain lists of participants, agenda, notes for discussion, and notes or memoranda summarizing the proceedings. There is also material on the planning and administration of special programs such as the International Division Programs for Women for the years 1975 to 1980. Other topics of special interest include Bell's meetings with the Chinese delegation of December 1980 and the Ford Foundation Pakistan Reviews of 1969 and 1979.

Bell maintained a flow of correspondence with Foundation colleagues and Trustees, Heads of State, ex-USAID colleagues, and grantee and other philanthropic organizations. Of special interest is the correspondence between Bell and such individuals as McGeorge Bundy, Henry Ford II, Alexander Heard, Soedjatmoko, and Patricia Ward, and such organizations as the Council on Foreign Relations, the Overseas Development Council, and several agencies of the United Nations.

For the meetings of the Ford Foundation Board of Trustees and its International, Executive, Finance, and Communications Committees for the years 1966 to 1980, the papers contain lists of participants, agenda, notes for discussion, and notes and/or memoranda summarizing the discussions. Of particular interest: the Special Board Review Meetings of 1976, and the Board of Trustees Meeting in India (1978).

During Bell's tenure, the Foundation was instrumental in the development of eight international centers for agricultural research. The papers are rich in material on five of the eight centers: the International Rice Research Institute (IRRI), the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA), the Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT), the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT), and the International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT). The papers document the centers' growth, their program planning and administration, and meetings and conferences from 1966 to 1981. There are lists of participants, agenda, notes for discussion, and Bell's notes summarizing the proceedings.

Most of the agricultural center material is related to: the activities of the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) and its Task Force on International Assistance for National Agricultural Research (ISNAR) for the years 1971 to 1976; the annual meetings of the International Centers Week for the years 1970 to 1979; the Ford and Rockefeller (Bellagio) Meetings on Agriculture and Development (1969-1970, 1975); and the activities of the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) for the years 1974 to 1979, as it sought and gained entry into the CGIAR system. Other topics of interest include the respective roles of CGIAR and the United Nations and Agricultural Organization (FAO) in agricultural development (1978), and the review of donor support to CGIAR and the centers (1979-1980).

The Population Program expanded considerably during Bell's tenure. The papers contain material on program planning, administration, and evaluation for this period. For the Ford and Rockefeller (Bellagio) Conferences on Population and Development from 1968 to 1979, the papers contain lists of participants, agenda, notes for discussion, and notes summarizing the proceedings. There is also material on the collaborative discussions with the Rockefeller Foundation on Roy O. Greep and Marjorie Koblinsky's "Reproduction and Human Welfare: A Challenge to Research" (1976); the subsequent meetings with Joseph Califano to discuss alternatives to abortion (1977); and a review of Ford Foundation field staff comment on Sol Chafkin's Health/Nutrition/Population (H/N/P) proposal to the Foundati on (1978-1981).

Finally, Bell retained material on selected Foundation procedures, divisions and offices of the Foundation other than the OVP/ID, selected subject areas in which grants were made, and selected surveys and studies. Of particular interest is the material on the Tax Reform Act of 1969 and the ID follow-up; and the Task Forces on Finance, Procedures, and FAPs (Foundation-Administered Projects).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers of David Bell are divided into six series:
I. International Division Files
II. General Correspondence Files
III. Trustee Meeting Files
IV. Agriculture Files
V. Population Files
VI. Subject Files

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Some groups of papers have been removed and placed with the appropriate collections within the Ford Foundation Archives:
- Files of F. F. Hill/F. Champion Ward/W. P. Gormbley
- Minutes and Dockets of Trustee Meetings
- Staff and consultant reports and publications.

Their locations have been noted on cross-reference sheets. A list of titles of reports removed from the papers is appended to this register. Papers not related to Ford Foundation activities have been pulled and discarded.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, International Division Files (1966-1981), is the most extensive. It contains material on the activities of the Office of the Vice President (OVP), International Division; its re-organization in 1966, and its administrative policies. There is extensive material on the program planning and administration of the Division's overseas field offices in the four program areas in effect at that time: AP, EIA, LAC, and MEA (Asia and Pacific, Europe and International Affairs, Latin America and the Caribbean, and Middle East and Africa). The substantial Budget sub-series includes material on the Program and Budget Reviews of 1979 and 1980. There are also files on the annual meetings and conferences of the International Division, and on the Overseas Development Self-Study of 1966-1967 ("0peration Janus").

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into the following five sub-series:
A. Office of the Vice President Files (1 box)
B. Field Office Files (4 boxes)
C. International Division Meetings and Conference Files (2 boxes)
D. International Division Budget Files (4 boxes)
E. Overseas Division Self-Study Files (0.5 boxes)

did.unittitle: Office of the Vice President Files

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into two sections. The first section consists of general material on the organization of the International Division. It is arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

The second section consists of files on International Division administration and special programs. It is arranged alphabetically by folder title. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

did.unittitle: ID Organization - Europe and Far East
Office of the Vice President/Int'l Division (General)
ID - Discretionary Awards, Travel and Study

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into four sections: the Asia and Pacific (AP), Europe and International Affairs (EIA), Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC), and Middle East and Africa (MEA) programs of the International Division. Within each section, the folders are arranged alphabetically, and within each folder, the material is arranged in reverse chronological order.

International Division Meetings and Conference Files

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into two sections: International Division divisional meetings and conferences, and International Division meetings and conferences on selected subjects. Within each section, the folders are arranged chronologically, and within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into the following sections: general files on the ID Budget, ID Budget Program Review files, and Bell's notes on selected subjects re: ID Budget/Program Reviews. Within each section, the folders are arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Th is sub-series is arranged according to the order in which it was originally received and consists of material on the OD Self-Study - "0peration Janus". Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

did.unittitle: OD Self-Study - ID Meeting/Beirut Jan. 1967 - General
OD Self-Study - ID Meeting/Beirut Jan. 1967 - Agenda and Summary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Correspondence (1966-1980), contains correspondence generated by Mr. Bell during his years at the Foundation. Correspondents include Foundation colleagues and Trustees, Heads of State, ex-USAID colleagues, and grantee and other philanthropic organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into the following two sub-series:
A. Alphabetical Files (3 boxes)
B. Chronological Files (7 boxes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files consist of Bell's selected incoming and outgoing correspondence with Ford Foundation trustees and colleagues, grantee and membership organizations, and other donor organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These files are arranged alphabetically. Within each folder, correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

did.unittitle: CFR - Discussion Group on Foreign Aid Policy
CFR - Discussion Group on Foreign Aid Policy
CFR - Special Discussion Group: Vietnam's Post-Conflict Problems

UN University - Human and Social Development Meeting, Tokyo, November 1975

United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files consist of Bell's routine outgoing correspondence ("chrons") with Ford Foundation trustees and colleagues, grantee and membership organizations, other donor organizations, heads of state, and ex-USAID colleagues.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These files are arranged chronologically. Within each year, they are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Johnson, A. A. - Johnson, H. G.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Trustee Meeting Files (1966-1980), contains material on the meetings of the Board of Trustees and its subcommittees: the International, Executive, Finance, and Communications Committees. Of particular interest are Bell's rough notes summarizing the meetings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged chronologically by date of meeting. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order. Files of the Board of Trustees meetings on a given date precede those of the subcommittees.

did.unittitle: Joint International/R and E Committee Meetings, Mar. 24, 1976
Special Board Review Meetings, June - July 1976
International Committee Meeting, Sept. 1976 - Education Paper

Board of Trustees Meeting, India - Oct. 2-6, 1978
Board of Trustees Meeting, Mar. 29-30, 1979 - background material
Board of Trustees Meeting, Mar. 27-28, 1980 - background material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV, Agriculture Files (1966-1979), contains material on the administrative and program development of five international centers for agricultural research and development. It includes extensive material on the meetings of the Consultative Group for International Research (CGIAR), and its Task Force on International Assistance for National Agricultural Research (ISNAR), of the annual International Centers Week, and of the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into the following four sub-series:
A. International Agricultural Center Files (2.5 boxes)
B. CGIAR/ISNAR Files (2 boxes)
C. Agriculture Meeting and Conference Files (1.5 boxes)
D. International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) Files (1 box)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first section of this subseries consists of general material on the administration and program development of five international agricultural centers. The second section of this subseries consists of files on each agricultural center.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into two sections. The first section is arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

The second section is arranged alphabetically by Ford Foundation program area in effect at that time (AP, LAC, MEA) and chronologically within each area. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first section of this subseries consists of material on the organization of the Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) and the procedures of its committee meetings. The second section of this subseries consists of material on the formation and committee meetings of the CGIAR's Task Force on International Assistance for National Agricultural Research (ISNAR).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into two sections. Within each section, the folders are arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first section of this subseries consists of material on the annual meetings of International Centers Week. The second section of this subseries consists of material on Ford and Rockefeller Foundation Conferences on Agriculture and Development.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is further divided into two sections. Within each section, the folders are arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series consists of material on the organization, administration, and periodic meetings of the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in chronological order. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V, Population Files (1966-1981), contains material on the program planning, evaluation, and administration of the Population Program. It includes extensive material on some principal grantee organizations and on Ford and Rockefeller (Bellagio) Conferences on Population and Development.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into the following two sub-series:
A. Ford Foundation Population Program Files (2 boxes)
B. Meetings and Conferences (1 box)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first section of this subseries consists of material on the program planning, administration, and evaluation of the Population Program. The second section of this subseries consists of files on grantee organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is further divided into two sections. The first section is arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order. The second section is arranged alphabetically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

did.unittitle: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh (ICDDRB)
United Nations Fund for Population Activities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first section of this subseries consists of material on Population Conferences funded by the Ford Foundation. The second section of this subseries consists of material on the Bellagio Population Conferences funded by the Rockefeller Foundation, attended by Mr. Bell and to which he contributed papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is further divided into two sections. Within each section, the folders are arranged chronologically. Within each folder, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation Population Meeting, Lake Como, Italy
Ford Foundation Population Meeting, Elsinore, Denmark

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VI, Subject Files (1966-1981), contains material on selected Foundation procedures, divisions and offices of the Foundation other than the Office of the Vice President/International Division, selected subject areas in which grants were made, selected surveys and studies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series consists of material on selected subject areas in which grants were made, divisions of the Foundation other than the OVP/ID, internal Foundation procedures, selected surveys and studies. It is arranged alphabetically. Within each file, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.
